fields.summary: Fix broken unit tests on Windows

status.description: The issue is open and ready for the assignee to start work on it.
status.name: Open

issuetype.description: A new unit, integration or system test.
issuetype.name: Test

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
status.name: Resolved

fields.description:
TestFileOutputCommitter.java fails on Windows.

Reason:

This is because in testMapFileOutputCommitterInternal, after executing MapFileOutputFormat.getReaders(outDir, conf), the readers are not properly closed. So other apis that attempt to delete the existing file fails due to the file handler already being used.

 

Solution:

Close all readers after call MapFileOutputFormat.getReaders(outDir, conf);

comments.body: Inside testMapFileOutputCommitterInternal, after calling MapFileOutputFormat.getReaders, close all the readers

[~giovanni.fumarola], can you take a look.
[~zuzhan], can you post the report for the windows run?
[~elgoiri] test report attached.
Hi [~giovanni.fumarola], do you mean the "slurp" function instead of "testConcurrentCommitTaskWithSubDirV2"?
Thanks [~jira.shegalov] for the comment. However, I didn't see a function named as IOUtils.closeStreams in 2.9.1, is it a newly added function in Hadoop 3.1.0?
[~zuzhan] you can use one of the older methods  {{cleanup(Log log, java.io.Closeable... closeables)}} with log passed as null. Looks like cleanupWithLogger can be used in 2.9.1
Thanks [~jira.shegalov] & [~giovanni.fumarola], uploaded a new patch.
LGTM pending Jenkins although I'd rather not do the unrelated and semantically neutral change in {{slurp}}

Thanks [~zuzhan] for the patch.

The patch looks good to me.
[~jira.shegalov], the current code can trigger future failures in Windows. The instruction new FileInputStream(f); should be within the try-catch.
[~giovanni.fumarola] the change in {{slurp}} does not introduce any {{catch}}. The patch is replacing try finally with the syntactic sugar version of the same.
I agree with [~jira.shegalov], no point on switching the try/finally with the new approach.

For tracking the issue, one can see that the Windows daily build has this issue consistently [here|https://builds.apache.org/job/hadoop-trunk-win/494/testReport/org.apache.hadoop.mapreduce.lib.output/TestFileOutputCommitter/].
[~elgoiri] [~jira.shegalov] Updated patch ver.002

Yetus seems to have executed the tests already [here|https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-MAPREDUCE-Build/7437/].
Not sure why they aren't posting yet.
+1 on  [^MAPREDUCE-7108.002.patch].
[~elgoiri] How can I complete the issue?

bq. How can I complete the issue?

A committer has to take care of it.
[~jira.shegalov], do you mind committing?
[~elgoiri], yes will do tonight
Resetting "Fix versions" because the jira is not committed yet. Adding "test" component.

[~elgoiri], [~zuzhan] Yetus was failing because fo the test reports attached:
{code}

  https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/attachment/12927337/MAPREDUCE-7108-TestFileOutputCommitter-Report.002.txt -> Downloaded
ERROR: Unsure how to process MAPREDUCE-7108.
{code}

Let me reattach 002 as 003 so it can be picked up as the latest patch.

[~zuzhan] for following JIRAs, don't use the JIRA prefix for the outputs, otherwise Yetus gets confused and tries to apply it.
Thanks [~jira.shegalov] for catching this.
Thanks [~elgoiri] and [~jira.shegalov] for pointing this out, will not add JIRA prefix next time.

SUCCESS: Integrated in Jenkins build Hadoop-trunk-Commit #14413 (See [https://builds.apache.org/job/Hadoop-trunk-Commit/14413/])
MAPREDUCE-7108. TestFileOutputCommitter fails on Windows. (Zuoming Zhang (gera: rev 04b74eddc67888142879ed114d21348e8a4aad78)
* (edit) hadoop-mapreduce-project/hadoop-mapreduce-client/hadoop-mapreduce-client-core/src/test/java/org/apache/hadoop/mapreduce/lib/output/TestFileOutputCommitter.java
